constraint.name: DCOM_11 - Activity Allocation Consistency
constraint.message: The non-leaf Operational Activity "{0}" is allocated the Operational Entity or role "{1}".
constraint.description: This rule checks the activity allocations consistency.

constraint.name: DCOM_03 - Terminating Function and ControlNode Allocation
constraint.message: The leaf "{0}"({1}) is not allocated by any Component.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a leaf Function and ControlNode should be allocated by a Component.

constraint.name: DCOM_13 - Exchange items allocation on Function Ports check
constraint.message: {0} (Function Exchange) conveys some Exchange Items which are not allocated to its source ({1}) and/or its target port ({2}).
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if the Function Exchange conveys some Exchange Items which are not allocated to its source ({1}) and/or its target port ({2}).

constraint.name: DCOM_20 - Functional Exchange delegation check
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if the the source or target of an Interaction/Functional Exchange is not allocated on a leaf function.

constraint.name: DCOM_21 - Unused function port Exchange Items
constraint.message: "{0}" ({1}) conveys "{2}" ({3}) which is not allocated to any associated Functional Exchange.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a Function Port conveys an Exchange Item which is not allocated to any connected Functional Exchange.

constraint.name: DCOM_22 - Unsynchronized Function Port Exchange Items
constraint.message: "{0}" ({1}) and all its connected Functional Exchanges do not have the exact same Exchange Items.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a Function Port and all its connected Functional Exchanges do not have the exact same Exchange Items.

constraint.name: DCOM_23 - Loops on same function check
constraint.message: {0} {1} loops on same {2} {3}.
constraint.description: This rule generates an error if there are loops identified on the same Function or Operational Activity.

constraint.name: TJ_G_01 - Component Port Realization
constraint.message: {0} (Component Port) is not realized by any other Component Port.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Component Port is realized by at least one Component Port.

constraint.name: TJ_G_02 - ComponentExchange realization
constraint.message: {0} (Component Exchange) in {1} is not realized by any other Component Exchange in {2}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Component Exchange is realized by at least one Component Exchange

constraint.name: TJ_G_03 - Functional Exchange Realization
constraint.message: {0} (Functional Exchange) in {1} is not realized by any other Functional Exchange in {2}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Functional Exchange is realized by at least one Functional Exchange.

constraint.name: TJ_G_04 - Functional Exchange Transitioned
constraint.message: {0} (Functional Exchange) is defined between {1} and {2}, but there is no exchange defined between the corresponding source and target elements in the previous phase.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Functional Exchange is transitioned from the upper Level.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_12 - A duplicate, a gather, a route, a select or a split function must be a leaf function
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) must be a leaf function.
constraint.description: This rule check that a duplicate, a gather, a route, a select or a split function must be a leaf function.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_14 - Functional chain involvement allocated exchange items
constraint.message: {0} (FunctionalChainInvolvement) allocates {1}(ExchangeItem) which {2} not allocated by involved functional exchange.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a functional chain involvement does not allocate exchange items which are not allocated by involved functional exchange.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_01 - A duplicate or a split function must have only one incoming exchange
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) must only have one incoming {2}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a duplicate or a split function have only one incoming exchange.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_02 - A gather function must have only one outgoing exchange
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) must have only one outgoing {2}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a gather function must have only one outgoing exchange.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_03 - Functional chain check
constraint.message: {0} (FunctionalChain) {1}
constraint.description: This rule checks that a FunctionalChain is valid.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_04 - Functional chain involvement check 1
constraint.message: ({0}) is not well formed. Involved element shall be set to {1}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Functional Chain Involvement only involves an Abstract Function, a Functional Exchange or a Functional Chain.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_05 - Functional chain involved functions active in state
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) contains at least one State/Mode which is not available in one of the functions involved in this {1}.
constraint.description: This check ensures that all the functions involved in FunctionalChain are also active in modes and states as FunctionChain.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_06 - Functional Exchange location check
constraint.message: The Functional Exchange "{0}" is not located in "{1}", the common ancestor between its source/target elements.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that Functional Exchange is located in the common ancestor between its source/target elements.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_15 - SequenceLinks between the referenced Involvement Functions/OperationalActivities have no Involvement Links referencing them
constraint.message: (SequenceLink) between the referenced {0}({1}) and {2}({3}) has no Involvement Links referencing them.
constraint.description: This check ensures that SequenceLinks between the referenced Involvement Functions have Involvement Links referencing them.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_16 - SequenceLink has empty condition
constraint.message: (SequenceLink) between {0}({1}) and {2}({3}) has empty condition.
constraint.description: This rule checks if there is an empty condition on the SequenceLink.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_17 - SequenceLink between two adjacent Control Nodes without a FunctionalChainInvolvementFunction
constraint.message: (SequenceLink) between two adjacent ControlNodes without a FunctionalChainInvolvementFunction.
constraint.description: This rule checks if there is a Sequence Link between two adjacent ControlNodes without a FunctionalChainInvolvementFunction.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_18 - SequenceLink with no associated FunctionalChainInvolvementLinks
constraint.message: (SequenceLink) between {0}({1}) and {2}({3}) has no associated FunctionalChainInvolvementLinks.
constraint.description: This rule checks if a SequenceLink has associated FunctionalChainInvolvementLinks.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_19 - SequenceLink with inconsistent associated FunctionalChainInvolvementLinks
constraint.description: This rule checks if a SequenceLink has inconsistent associated FunctionalChainInvolvementLinks.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_20 - SequenceLink between the referenced Involvement Functions/OperationalActivities is in opposite direction to Involvement Links referencing them
constraint.description: This rule checks if a SequenceLink between the referenced Involvement Functions/OperationalActivities is in opposite direction to a Involvement Links referencing them.

constraint.name: DWF_DF_21 - Control Nodes inconsistent operations
constraint.description: This rule checks the ControlNode construction inconsistencies. A ControlNode is valid if it has one IN and two OUT links or two IN and one OUT link.

constraint.name: DCOV_09 - Component port Component Exchanges check
constraint.message: {0} (Component Port) is neither used by any Component Exchange nor providing/requiring any Interface.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if there is neither Component Exchanges using the target Component Port nor providing/requiring any Interface.

constraint.name: DCOV_10 - Function port exchanges check
constraint.message: {0} (Function Port) is not used by any functional exchange
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if there is no functional exchange using the target Input/Output Function Port

constraint.name: I_12 - Function Realization
constraint.message: Realization consistency error for {0}.
constraint.description: This test checks the realization consistency between functions.

constraint.name: I_27 - Functional chain involvement check 3
constraint.message: {0} (Functional Chain Involvement) has an empty next and/or previous involvement.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Functional Chain Involvement has a valid next and/or previous involvement (not empty)

constraint.name: I_14 - Functional Exchange Realization
constraint.message: Realization consistency error for {0}.
constraint.description: This rule checks the realization consistency between functional exchanges.

constraint.name: I_15 - Component Exchange Functional Exchange Realization
constraint.message: Realization consistency error for {0}.
constraint.description: This rule checks the realization consistency between Functional Exchanges and Component Exchange.

constraint.name: I_20 - ComponentExchange port orientation
constraint.description:
This rule cheks that source and target port orientations of a ComponentExchange are consistent, i.e.
- A source port cannot have orientation'IN' - A target port cannot have orientation 'OUT'
In Case the ComponentExchange is of kind DELEGATION - "source port/target Port" can only have orientation 'IN/IN' or 'OUT/OUT'

constraint.name: I_35 - Related functional exchanges must have identical names
constraint.message: {0} (Functional Exchange) should have identical names
constraint.description: This rule checks that Functional Exchanges connected to the same source and/or target port have identical names.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_11 - Component Functional Allocation
constraint.message: Function allocation level consistency error for {0}.
constraint.description: This rule checks the allocation level consistency between functions and components to avoid allocations of system functions in logical architecture.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_28 - Delegation out of place check
constraint.description: This rule check that Component Exchange of kind Delegation if not out of place and useless. It also make sure if Delegation source and target are not null.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_31 - ComponentPort on NodePC
constraint.description:
This rule ensures that ComponentPort is not contained in NodePC.
NodePC=Physical Component of nature NODE

constraint.name: DWF_DC_32 - Component Exchange with out port on NodePC
constraint.description:
This rule ensures that ComponentExchange with out port sourceEnd or target end is not NodePC.
NodePC=Physical Component of nature NODE

constraint.name: DWF_DC_12 - Function Allocation Unicity
constraint.message: Non-unicity of function allocation for {0}
constraint.description: This rule checks that a function is allocated to only one component (including Actor)

constraint.name: DWF_DC_13 - Component Exchange Functional Exchanges Realization
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) which is at level {2} should not realize {3} ({4}) which is at level {5}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that the Functional Exchanges allocated to a Component Exchange come from the same level.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_14 - Component Port Allocation
constraint.message: Allocation consistency error for {0} (Component Port).
constraint.description: This rule checks Ports Allocations consistency.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_15 - Function Allocation Consistency
constraint.message: Leaf Function Allocation Consistency error for {0}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that only leaf functions are allocated.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_16 - Component Exchange encapsulation problem check
constraint.message: {0} (Component Exchange) causes an encapsulation problem.
constraint.description: This rule raises a warning if a Component Exchange is linked between two internal components. These components can be directly connected, only if the ports are delegated throughout the owning components which are connected by another Component Exchange.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_18 - Component Exchange location check
constraint.message: The Component Exchange "{0}" is not located in "{1}", the common ancestor between its source/target elements "{1}".
constraint.description: This rule ensures that Component Exchange is located in the common ancestor between its source/target elements.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_27 - Functional Exchange Component Exchange Allocation Unicity
constraint.message: Non-unicity of component exchange allocation for {0}
constraint.description: This rule checks that a functional exchange is allocated to only one component exchange.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_29 - Component Exchange Functional Exchange consistency
constraint.description: This rule ensures that Component Exchange allocates valid functional exchanges (regarding ports directions).

constraint.name: DWF_DC_35 - Function is not available in at least one Mode/State allocated to a functional chain in which the function is involved
constraint.message: {0} (Function) is not available in at least one Mode/State allocated to a functional chain in which the {1} is involved.
constraint.description: Check that the function is available in all the Mode/State allocated to a functional chain in which the function is involved.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_43 - Component Exchange has an UNSET Kind
constraint.message: {0} (ComponentExchange) has an UNSET kind.
constraint.description: Check if the Component Exchange has an UNSET kind.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_45 - Non-unicity of Component Exchange allocation
constraint.message: Non-unicity of Component Exchange allocation for {0}
constraint.description: This rules checks that a Component Exchange is allocated to only one Physical Link

constraint.name: TC_DF_01 - Component Exchange realization consistency
constraint.message: {0} (Component Exchange) realizes a ComponentExchange from a previous level. Bounds of this Component Exchange should be consistent with definition from previous phase. A bound ComponentPort should realize the bound ComponentPort of the realized Component Exchange or be a delegated port of a realizing port.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Component Exchange realizing a Component Exchange from a previous level has bounds consistent with realized Component Exchange bounds.

constraint.name: TC_DF_02 - Function port refinement check
constraint.message: {0} (Function Port) isn't defined in a function or a sub-function realizing the function containing the port which has been realized.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a port isn't defined in a function or a sub-function realizing the function containing the port which has been realized. A warning can be raised if you have performed a drag and drop of the port to another function but this function is not a sub-function of the function containing the port which has been realized and there is no traceability link from the current function and the function containing the port which has been realized. You should add manually a traceability link from the parent function of the realized port and the function containing the port which has been realized.

constraint.name: TC_DF_03 - Functional chain involvement refinement check
constraint.message: A FunctionalChainInvolvement with a tracability link to another FunctionalChainInvolvement involving a function should involves a function or a sub-function realizing the involved function of the FunctionalChainInvolvement which has been realized.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a FunctionalChainInvolvement doesn't involves a function or a sub-function of the function which is involved by the FunctionalChainInvolvement which has been realized.

constraint.name: TC_DF_04 - Component Exchange conveyed information check
constraint.message: The {1} (ExchangeItem) is defined into {2} level and realized into the {3} level. {0} Component Exchange conveys {1} ExchangeItem instead of conveying realized ExchangeItem.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Component Exchange conveying ExchangeItems doesn't convey an ExchangeItem from a previous level whereas it is realized in the same level than the Component Exchange. Component Exchange should convey the realized ExchangeItem. A warning can be raised if you have performed a transition of the Component Exchange before performing a transition of the conveyed ExchangeItem. You should perform another transition of the Component Exchange from the lower level to use the realized ExchangeItem.

constraint.name: TC_DF_05 - Functional exchange bounds refinement consistency check
constraint.message: Both bounds of Functional Exchange should realize bounds of the realized FunctionalExchange.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a bound of the FunctionalExchange doesn't realize a bound of the realized FunctionalExchange.

constraint.name: TC_DF_06 - Functional exchange bounds refinement check
constraint.message: A bound of {0} (FunctionalExchange) isn't defined in a function or a sub-function realizing the function containing the bound of the realized FunctionalExchange.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a bound of FunctionalExchange isn't defined in a function or a sub-function of the function containing the bound which has been realized. A warning can be raised if you have performed a drag and drop of the bound to another function but this function is not a sub-function realizing the function containing the bound which has been realized and there is no traceability link from the current function and the function containing the bound which has been realized. You should add manually a traceability link from the parent function of the realized bound and the function containing the bound which has been realized.

constraint.name: TC_DF_07 - Functional exchange conveyed exchange items check
constraint.message: The {1} (ExchangeItem) is defined into {2} level and realized into the {3} level. {0} FunctionalExchange is linked to {1} ExchangeItem instead of be linked to realized ExchangeItem.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a FunctionalExchange isn't linked to an ExchangeItem from a previous level whereas it is realized in the same level than the FunctionalExchange. FunctionalExchange should be linked to the realized ExchangeItem. A warning can be raised if you have performed a transition of the FunctionalExchange before performing a transition of the linked ExchangeItem. You should perform another transition of the FunctionalExchange from the lower level to use the realized ExchangeItem.

constraint.name: TC_DF_08 - Function Kind consistency
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) doesn't have same kind than realized Function {2} ({3}).
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Function realizing a Function from a previous level has same kind.

constraint.name: TC_DF_09 - Function kind condition consistency
constraint.description: The rule ensure that Funtion of kind ROUTE and SELECT can only have Condition set.

constraint.name: TC_DF_10 - Function port realization check
constraint.message: {0} (Function Port) shall be realized by a lower level function port.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a function port is not realized by a lower level function port.

constraint.name: TC_DF_11 - Function port realization check
constraint.message: {0} (Function Port) on {1} (Function) shall realize {2} (Function Port) on {3} (Function)
constraint.description: This rule checks that considering a Function F1 containing this Function Port P1 that carries an Exchange Item E1. If E1 is carried by another Function Port P2 contained by a Function F2 and F2 is realized by F1, then a warning is generated if P2 is not realized by P1.

constraint.name: TC_DF_12 - Function port realization check
constraint.message: {0} (Function Port) on {1} (Function) shall be realized by {2} (Function Port) on {3} (Function)
constraint.description: This rule checks that considering a Function F1 containing this Function Port P1 that carries an Exchange Item E1. If E1 is carried by another Function Port P2 contained by a Function F2 and F2 realizes F1, then a warning is generated if P2 doesn't realize P1.

constraint.name: TC_DF_13 - Function port allocated exchange items check
constraint.message: All exchange items allocated by {0} (FunctionPort) shall be allocated by one of its realizing function ports
constraint.description: This rule verifies that all exchange items allocated by a function port are allocated by one of its realizing function ports.

constraint.name: TC_DF_14 - Function port owner realization check
constraint.message: {0} (Function} shall be realized by {1} (Function} : both contain a function port having a realization link between them
constraint.description: This rule verifies that a realization link exists between two functions containing a function port having a realization link.

constraint.name: TC_DF_15 - Root Function Realization
constraint.message: {0} does not realize {1}.
constraint.description: This rule ensures the realization consistency between Root Functions.

constraint.name: TC_DC_05 - Component exchange bounds refinement consistency check
constraint.message: Both bounds of Component Exchange should realize bounds of the realized ComponentExchange
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if a bound of the ComponentExchange doesn't realize a bound of the realized ComponentExchange.

constraint.name: TC_DC_06 - Component Port Realization
constraint.message: {0} (ComponentPort) realizes a ComponentPort from a previous level. It should be consistent with definition from previous level: the ComponentPort should realize the ComponentPort or should be a delegated port of the realizing port.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Component Port realizing a Component Port from a previous level is contained into a Component realizing the Component which contains the realized port (or in a sub-component).

constraint.name: TC_DC_07 - Component Functional Allocation
constraint.message: The ComponentFunctionalAllocation realizes a ComponentFunctionalAllocation from a previous level. The allocating component should realize the allocating component of the realized ComponentFunctionalAllocation or be contained by a realizing component. The allocated function of the ComponentFunctionalAllocation should also realize the allocated function defined in the realized ComponentFunctionalAllocation or be a sub-function of a realizing function.
constraint.description: The rule checks if ComponentFunctionalAllocation which realizes a ComponentFunctionalAllocation from a previous level has its allocated component and its allocating function related to the realized ComponentFunctionalAllocation component and function.

constraint.name: TC_DC_08 - Component Exchange Functional Exchange Allocation
constraint.message: The ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation realizes a ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation from a previous level. The allocating ComponentExchange should realize the allocating Component Exchange of the realized ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation. The allocated FunctionalExchange of the ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation should also realize the allocated FunctionalExchange defined in the realized ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation.
constraint.description: The rule checks if ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation which realizes a ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation from a previous level has its allocated Component Exchange and its allocating FunctionalExchange related to the realized ComponentExchangeFunctionalExchangeAllocation ComponentExchange and FunctionalExchange.

constraint.name: DWF_I_08 - Component port required and provided interface check
constraint.message: {0} (Component port) is not supposed to provide / require an interface defined elsewhere than the physical architecture.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Component port requires/provides the interfaces of its own level.
